channel.title: 2xp command and constant in wild
channel.description:
How and where specifically would i create these 2? I would like a constant 2xp in the wilderness and a command for 2xp weekend making the total in wilderness 4xp
So, my question is how would i introduce these both without a conflict occurring?

item.title: 2xp command and constant in wild
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“suseto21, post:18, topic:554481”]I got it figured out finally. I created the methods and it compiled.

[code]public Boolean inWilderness() {
return false;
}
in player.java

in skills.java

private Boolean isWeekend() {
return false;
}
[/code][/quote]
Yeah but they’re literally always returning false.
So there will never be double (or 4x) xp. Ever.
Also: boolean is lowercase. Not upper.

Read full topic

item.title: 2xp command and constant in wild
item.dc:creator: @Roar337 Roar337
item.description:
@Roar337 wrote:

if(isWeekend() || inWild()) {
c.xpMod = 2;
}

private void addXP(Client c, int skillId) {
c.addSkillXp(skillId, xpAmt * c.xpMod)
}

No reason to change everywhere skill xp is being added lulz.

Read full topic

item.title: 2xp command and constant in wild
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“suseto21, post:15, topic:554481”]Would something like this be sufficient?

public boolean isWeekend(int skill, double exp) { if (player.inWilderness() && isWeekend())// another double xp cause weekend. Note: make the isWeekend() method or similar. exp *= 2; return true;[/quote]
No. First, you’d get errors for the isWeekend() not using enough parameters in the code (You defined the method with 2. you’re using it with 0).
Second, you have no reason to have the int skill, or the double exp as you’re supposed to be checking what day it is. Not only that, they’re not used. You’re just returning true for the method regardless of what the values are.
Third, the point of the isWeekend() boolean was supposed to be that it returns true if it is the weekend and returns false otherwise. It should have nothing to do with player variables.

Read full topic

public boolean isWeekend(int skill, double exp) { if (player.inWilderness() && isWeekend())// another double xp cause weekend. Note: make the isWeekend() method or similar. exp *= 2; return true;

item.title: 2xp command and constant in wild
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Dude.
Do not copy and paste everything… That’s why you’re getting errors.

[quote=“suseto21, post:12, topic:554481”]Edit: If the error is derived from the lack of methods, how would I declare them? Would it be with a Public Void method?
How would I grab the settings for the date and time?[/quote]
You need to create a method that returns a boolean. A “public void method” returns nothing. Therefore, it will error because "It’s not a statement"
Java || Defining Methods

item.title: 2xp command and constant in wild
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Please… please clean that code up…

if (skill >= ATTACK && skill <= RANGE)//0 = attack. 6 = ranged. all other combat skills are between that. exp *= Settings.COMBAT_XP_RATE;// skill is combat, give combat xp. else exp *= Settings.SKILLING_XP_RATE;

Why are you checking if the skill isn’t one of these, and then giving them the same bonus anyways?:

if (skill != PRAYER && skill != DUNGEONEERING && skill != SUMMONING && skill != FARMING) exp *= 5; if (skill != THIEVING && skill != DUNGEONEERING && skill != SUMMONING && skill != FARMING) exp *= 5; if (skill == THIEVING) exp *= 5; if (skill == FARMING) exp *= 5; if (skill == SUMMONING) exp *= 5; if (skill == DUNGEONEERING) exp *= 5;
It just doesn’t make sense. You exclude them, and give them the same bonus 1 line later.

if (skill != PRAYER) exp *= 5; if (skill != DUNGEONEERING && skill != SUMMONING && skill != FARMING) exp *= 5;
^Does basically the same as your 6 if statements.

Also, you’d add the multiplier right after that bit of code.
So it essentially looks like…

player.getControlerManager().trackXP(skill, (int) exp); if (skill >= ATTACK && skill <= RANGE)//0 = attack. 6 = ranged. all other combat skills are between that. exp *= Settings.COMBAT_XP_RATE;// skill is combat, give combat xp. else// Non-cb gets non-cb rates exp *= Settings.SKILLING_XP_RATE; if (player.getAuraManager().usingWisdom()) exp *= 10; if (skill != PRAYER) exp *= 5; if (skill != DUNGEONEERING && skill != SUMMONING && skill != FARMING) exp *= 5; if(player.inWilderness())// double xp cause wildy exp *= 2; if(player.inWilderness() && isWeekend())// another double xp cause weekend. Note: make the isWeekend() method or similar. exp *= 2; int oldLevel = getLevelForXp(skill); xp[skill] += exp; xpCounter += exp; refreshXpCounter(); if (xp[skill] > MAXIMUM_EXP) { xp[skill] = MAXIMUM_EXP; }

Read full topic

item.title: 2xp command and constant in wild
item.dc:creator: @suseto21 suseto21
item.description:
@suseto21 wrote:

Okay, so here is my problem, despite how I provide player.inWilderness that statement is not being recognized to be valid. I was told prior to provide some code so here it is.
This is what my exp rates multiplier looks like at the moment. I tried modifying the if statement to what the others look like, but without specifying a certain skill creating two of each of those, perhaps in a separate file or in Wilderness.java, I can’t seem to find a way to create one. Perhaps, its my inexperience and I apologize if any of this irritates anyone, but I could really use some help.

player.getControlerManager().trackXP(skill, (int) exp); if (skill != ATTACK && skill != DEFENCE && skill != STRENGTH && skill != MAGIC && skill != RANGE && skill != HITPOINTS) exp *= Settings.SKILLING_XP_RATE; else exp *= Settings.COMBAT_XP_RATE; if (player.getAuraManager().usingWisdom()) exp *= 10; if (skill != PRAYER && skill != DUNGEONEERING && skill != SUMMONING && skill != FARMING) exp *= 5; if (skill != THIEVING && skill != DUNGEONEERING && skill != SUMMONING && skill != FARMING) exp *= 5; if (skill == THIEVING) exp *= 5; if (skill == FARMING) exp *= 5; if (skill == SUMMONING) exp *= 5; if (skill == DUNGEONEERING) exp *= 5; int oldLevel = getLevelForXp(skill); xp[skill] += exp; xpCounter += exp; refreshXpCounter(); if (xp[skill] > MAXIMUM_EXP) { xp[skill] = MAXIMUM_EXP; }

Read full topic

item.title: 2xp command and constant in wild
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:554481”][quote author=X-J-K-X link=topic=673405.msg4503639#msg4503639 date=1454428465]
Oops, the product of not caring right there

if (player.inWilderness && (dayIsSaturday || dayIsSunday)) xp *=2;

or

if (player.inWilderness && weekend()) xp *=2;
[/quote]
Why?
You need to make the XP stack.

if(player.inWilderness()) { xp= xp *2; } if(isWeekend()) { xp= xp *2; }[/quote]

Providing he added the first one

if (player.inWilderness) xp*=2;

the second one would stack on top of that because it seems he only wants it for the wilderness

making the total in wilderness 4xp

Read full topic

or
